intro: Eriogonum triste, commonly known as the sad goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Eriogonum triste is generally not considered showy but plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for insects and other wildlife.
